greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Successive run lengths in decimal expansion of Pi.
example: a(25) = 2 as the 25th run, the first run of two or more identical digits in 3.14159265358979323846264338..., consists of the two 3s following the first 24 digits.
mathematica: Length /@ Split@RealDigits[Pi, 10, 111][[1]] (* _Robert G. Wilson v_, Aug 16 2006 *)
results.author: _Rick L. Shepherd_, Aug 13 2006
